data.title: MAXEMovie Reviews
data.text:
Scarface

For my last post I’ve decided to review probably of my favourite and most watched film, the cult classic Scarface ‘Scarface’ directed by Brian De Palma follows the rise and fall of Cuban immigrant and total bad ass Tony Montana played by Al Pacino. The film also includes Steven Bauer who plays Montana’s long time … Continue reading →

Apocalypto

Max here again im reviewing the 2006 historical action adventure film, directed by Mel Gibson ‘Apocalypto’ Apocalypto gives us insight in to the mesoamerican Maya civilisation leading up to their downfall. The cast is relatively unknown with the main character Jaguar Paw being played by Rudy Youngblood who looks so much like Brazilian soccer star … Continue reading →

The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas

Set during World War II, ‘The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas’ tells the touching story of Bruno, an eight-year-old son of the commandant at the Auschwitz concentration camp, who forms a forbidden friendship with a Jewish boy on the other side of the camp fence. The movie was released in 2008, based on the 2006 … Continue reading →

It’s all gone Pete Tong

‘It’s all gone Pete Tong’ is one of my favourite movies of all time. A mokumentary directed and written by Michael Dowse, follows the downfall of DJ Frankie Wilde played by Paul Kaye, a legend in the dance music and Ibiza club scene. Who falls deaf due to exposure to loud noise over the years. … Continue reading →

The Dilemma

The newest movie I’ve chosen to review is ‘The Dilemma’ starring Vince Vaughn, Kevin Jones and Wynona Ryder. ‘The Dilemma’ is a comedy but i find a hard time believing this as i think I only laughed about once during the entire film. I am a massive Vince Vaughn and I have to say this … Continue reading →

Glee…in 3D!

So, being a total Gleek (yes, I have no shame) when I found out yesterday that Glee co-creator Ryan Murphy announced the ‘Glee Live! In Concert’ tour will be turned into a 3D movie later this year, I could not have been more excited. Even better, it will be released on August 12th… my birthday! … Continue reading →

The Lovely Bones

Wow, I just realised I have not been to the cinemas in a really long time. I don’t have any new movies in mind to discuss, but I am currently in the middle of a book entitled The Lovely Bones, and thought this would be the perfect opportunity to talk about the film adaption of … Continue reading →

Across the Universe

Across the Universe is a musical romantic drama that was released in October of 2007. The movie centres around a few main characters, but draws attention on Jude (Jim Sturgess), a young shipyard worker from Liverpool, and Lucy (Evan Rachel Wood), an upper-class American girl, who fall in love amidst the Vietnam War era. Jude … Continue reading →

Arthur

Max back again, and im going to review the movie ‘Arthur’ starring Russell Brand, Jennifer Gardner and Helen Mirren ‘Arthur’ a remake of the original 1981 film, remakes and sequels seem to be the trend in Hollywood at the moment. It seems to be hard for these companies to come up with new and original … Continue reading →

Fear and Loathing In Las Vegas

“We can’t stop here. This is bat country.” Hi Max here, I thought I’d write a review on one of my favourite and I think funniest movies ive seen. Not to mention one of the most quotable. Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas, based on the book written by Hunter S. Thompson. Is about journalist … Continue reading →
